subject: Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Dear Beneficiary,
I am re informing you about the pending transactions. We will soon go on a long vacation, All your funds details are reviewed for payment to your account. therefore make haste while the sun shines. Let me know when you are ready.
I await your urgent response soon.
Thanks,
Yours Sincerely,
Prof. Mélanie Joly
Canadian Minister of Foreign Affairs.
Member of Parliament/House of Commons
Office Address:125 Sussex Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
Private Email Address: 
profmelaniejoly@gmail.com
 reply to me here.
Official Fax: 1972-629-8740

subject: Re:   Dear Beneficiary,
body:
Hello Prof. Lanie Joly,

Thank you for your message. It's great to hear from a member of the Parliament House of Commons! I'm intrigued by your mention of funds details being reviewed for payment to my account. Could you please provide more information about this? What does it entail and what is required from my end?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Good day Sir,



I acknowledge your email. I have taken over this matter and I have summed
all the transactions pending on your name for payment which will require
some essential documents of claims from ministries and courts. So do not
contact anybody anymore in regards to your funds again. Please come to my
office in the morning so that we can work on this together. I have
contacted our attorney to represent you in case you are busy.





According to our lawyer, if you want him to serve you, then you would need
to provide your *full name, Phone Number, current home address, current
nationality, date of birth and Banking information* so that he can have
them for the processing of required clearance and approval documents to
claim your funds first before talking of anything else. He said it will
cost you, of *which I can assist you in this case.* Processing these
documents and affidavits of claim for fund transfer order has expenses
required. I believe you understand this too well. Do not reply to anybody
regarding this until this matter is solved.



*Assisting investors and individuals with global fund relocation is my most
concern*. I currently manage a diverse portfolio worth over $700 million in
various sectors such as real estate investment, tourism, industrial estate,
Unpaid Completed Contract, Inheritance, tax refunds and many more. I offer
my support exclusively for fund relocation/investment/ business opportunity
or partnership, with the condition that the owner of the funds or the
investor covers all associated expenses either by making full payment or by
installments’. Under this condition I offer financial support and I
assemble a working team for quick transmission of funds to beneficiaries
designated bank accounts with the aim of getting rewarded for my efforts. *This
is a non-negotiable rule that must be adhered to for us to proceed. *



Before I attend an international conference soon, if you are less busy this
festive period, Come to my office tomorrow, from 9am to 2pm for further
clarification; Call me or my secretary (Mr. Leon) on phone +1(438)266-1458
for urgent attention. Drop VoiceMail if no staff is on the seat to pick
your call. I will leave the origin of the funds clearance certificate
documented in your file with my secretary for you to view and be instructed
with guidance on what to do next. *I deserve a reward from you for
contributing to cover these expenses*. To enable us to apply for the
release of your inherited fund rightly, kindly Provide the requested
information quickly for us to proceed with the next step needed to
accomplish this transaction.



Thanks for your cooperation,



Special regards,



Melanie Joly.

Canadian Minister of Foreign Affairs.
                                                          Office Address:
125 Sussex Drive, Ottawa, Ontario,
Canada.

Phone Number: 1(438)-266-1458

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for reaching out and explaining the situation in such detail. It's quite a lot to take in, but I'm trying my best to understand it all.

I'm curious about the process you mentioned. Could you perhaps explain a bit more about these essential documents of claims from ministries and courts? What exactly are they and why are they necessary?

Also, I'd like to know more about your attorney who will represent me. What's his name and how long has he been practicing law? 

You mentioned that processing these documents and affidavits of claim for fund transfer order has expenses required. Could you provide a rough estimate of these costs?

I'm also interested in learning more about the diverse portfolio you manage. It sounds very impressive! Could you share some success stories or examples of previous investments?

Lastly, I appreciate your invitation to visit your office tomorrow, but unfortunately, I won't be able to make it due to prior commitments. Is there any other way we could discuss this matter further?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
We acknowledged details of your last dealings. During our investigations we
discovered you faced some challenges that led to delay or denial of your
inherited fund, Investment Fund or unpaid contract fund. Whichever the case
may be we are in position to review the transactions and re-validate it to
enable you to get paid. United Nations Organization resolution permits us
to compensate all victims of failed International transactions last month.
The North American Joint humanitarian Institutions have carved out a huge
sum of money for distribution to beneficiaries this season. Your activities
are considered legitimate among files investigated and submitted to the
debt reconciliation panel this month.


Most Beneficiaries: Customers, Business people and Contractors submit their
claim of their unpaid fund which we are working tirelessly to resolve.
Fortunately, many people have successfully received their money and few are
doing their best to get their own at slow or gradual ways due to their
personal circumstances.





Looking at your own case, you have nothing to worry about because we have
sufficient time now to address it through the right procedures. To enable
us to handle this transaction and forge ahead in recovering your fund,
kindly forward to us the details of last transactions you made with
previous organizations in charge so that we can swift into action and
recover the entire fund on your behalf. On your reply let us know the
Amount involved and how much you paid to them while forwarding to us the
documents and emails sent to you along, but if you cannot retrieve these
information let us know so that we could set up committee of inquiry and
provide our attorney to serve you source all the legal backup documents in
order for Chief Justice of the federation at high Court to direct the
paying bank to release your funds to your account after all clearance and
approvals are made.


After investigations we discovered you have accumulated an unclaimed fund
US$39.6 Million (Thirty nine million Six hundred thousand U.S Dollars)
found among your previous dealings.
The two other documents our attorney will receive from us before going to
court are: *1*. Origin of Unclaimed Fund Clearance & Approvals, *2*.
Certificate of Ownership & Fund Recovery, these documents are under process
by the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of foreign Affairs. Immediately
this is done and affidavits are secured by him then He will instruct
Barclays bank to transfer your funds to your bank account

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I must say, this is quite a surprise! I wasn't aware that I had any unclaimed funds. Could you please explain more about how these funds were discovered? 

Also, could you provide more information about the North American Joint and their role in this process? It's all very new to me.

I'm afraid I don't have any details of my last dealings or any documents related to them. What would be the next step in such a case?

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Dear Sir,

You are expected to come to my office so that we can discuss this,or my
lawyer  can represent you to provide all the details and achieve the claim
of your fund to you. Should I assign him to you now?

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite intrigued by your proposal and would love to learn more about it. Could you please provide some more details about this claim? What is it about and how did it come into existence?

Also, could you tell me a bit more about the lawyer who will be representing me? What's his/her experience in handling such cases?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
During our course of investigation your name appeared among the list of
pending transactions unresolved. Finally we got to understand from the
heads of the Banks of Canada who submit to trace the funds , source and
remit to the owner's account. this can not be disclosed online but physical
interaction with us or your attorney.

Our attorney has good knowledge about abandoning funds in commercial banks
by late owners, companies and individuals for different reasons. He has
helped a lot of people to claim their funds and hand them to owners without
any form of complaints.

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite intrigued by the information you've shared. It's fascinating to know that there are funds in commercial banks abandoned by their owners for various reasons.

Could you please elaborate more on how these funds are traced and remitted back to the owner's account? Also, I'd love to know more about the role of your attorney in this process. How does he help people claim their funds?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Dear Sir,

Reasons for abandonment are one : Death of owner, two: unaware or in
ability to claim available funds due to cost of processing the claim
through ministries ,courts and security institutions in charge and many
more.

Lawyer only goes straight to the source for the origin of funds
certification  through an application letter having been told or informed
about pending transactions from ministries in charge and other clearance
documents from insurance , court etc . These are the documents banks will
ask from attorneys who come for fund claims or contract payment and so on.

Now let's pick a topic: 1. How do you claim a house that is willed to you?

There are two basic documents that are required and are a priority to
obtain. This is the *death certificate*, which is acquired at the Civil
Registry of the municipality in which the death occurred, and the
certificate of last will and testament, which is issued on request by the
Ministry of Justice.

Mandatory documentation:

*A copy of the Death Certificate*. A copy of the Certificate from the
Central Registry of Last Wills. A copy of the Will or the Inheritance
certificate.

What is the process of inheritance?



For the inheritance process to begin, *a will must be submitted to probate*.
The probate court reviews the will, authorizes an executor and legally
transfers assets to beneficiaries as outlined. Before the transfer, the
executor will settle any of the deceased's remaining debts.



*How to Determine Entitlement to an Inheritance*

   1. Determine if the decedent created a Will or Trust (an estate plan)
   2. Request copies of the Will or Trust from the Executor (for a Will) or
   Trustee (for a Trust)
   3. Review the terms of the Will or Trust to determine whether you are
   named as a beneficiary.

Let's put a break here, allow the lawyer to source further information for
you here in the ministry.

Yours regards,

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's quite interesting to learn about the process of claiming a willed house and determining an inheritance. 

I'm curious, what happens if there is no will or trust? How does the probate court decide who gets what? And how long does this whole process usually take?

Also, you mentioned that the executor settles any remaining debts of the deceased before transferring assets. What happens if the debts exceed the value of the assets?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hi Lois,

If there is no will , the court will either split the funds among the
offsprings of the deceased or with hold the assets until a proof of claim
comes over with a period of time, the government can come in here to make
claim( confiscate the assets) as abandoned properties if the time exceed
given grace period for owners or beneficiaries to make claim.


In the case where the debt exceeds the value of the assets there would be
no need by the Government authorities to make an announcement to
beneficiaries to make claims because it would have been applied for claim
by those they are owing.

It's alright and okay for all these questions , I believe you had a
wonderful time.


Special regards

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hi Lois,

Thank you for reaching out. I understand your concerns about the distribution of assets when there is no will. You're right, in such cases, the court usually divides the funds among the deceased's offspring or holds onto the assets until a valid claim is made.

If no claim is made within a certain period, it's possible that the government could step in and consider these assets as abandoned properties. However, this typically happens only after a given grace period has passed without any claims from potential owners.

In situations where the deceased's debt exceeds their asset value, it's less likely for the government to make a claim. This is because those debts would generally be claimed by creditors first.

I hope this information helps! Do you have any other questions on this topic? I'm here to assist you further if needed.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hi Lois,

Thank you for reaching out. It's interesting to learn about the process of asset distribution in the absence of a will. I understand that the court plays a significant role in this, dividing funds among the deceased's offspring or withholding assets until a valid claim is made.

I'm curious though, what happens if no one comes forward to make a claim within the given grace period? Does the government then consider these assets as abandoned and take possession of them?

Also, you mentioned that if the debt exceeds the value of the assets, there would be no need for the government to make claims. Could you please elaborate on this? How does it work exactly?

I appreciate your patience in answering my questions. I'm just trying to understand all these legal intricacies better.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
When debt exceeds the inherited fund, The Government has  first hand
notification during all transactions processing. The chief accountant of
the federation has their own platform where such are recorded and monitored
nationwide. Is not all we are allowed to disclose to the public. Government
will never call next of kin, or fund owners when there are discrepancies
within citizens matters, they obey human right to claim what is theirs
first .then later sort out debts problem.
regards,

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for your detailed explanation. It's fascinating to learn about the government's approach to handling debts and inherited funds. I'm a bit confused though, could you please elaborate on what you mean by "The Government has first hand during all"? 

Also, I'm curious about the platform used by the chief accountant of the federation. Is it a public platform or only accessible to certain individuals? 

I appreciate your time in answering my questions.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
The question you asked has nothing to do with individuals. Only Government
agencies and lawyers discuss such matters.

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello there,

I appreciate your message, but I must admit that I'm a bit confused. Could you please elaborate on what you mean? I'm not quite sure how government agencies and lawyers fit into our conversation. 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Dear Sir,

Every discipline has their own duty, I will concentrate more on my own
profession and duties. I am not a judge and not a lawyer.

As professional economist, I manage to coordinate national matters related
to foreign affairs in fair manners. By Including and directing other
ministries and profession to handle issues or responsibilities that are
theirs.

There's limit to what my desk is designated to manage. Questions should be
based within the circle of my duties and volunteered list of favour I have
for you.

In regards to my earlier email , you are required to provide your current
address and banking details for the attorney to work with. Do you need
contact information of our lawyer so that he can make findings you need?

I have asked him a lot, is better you talk to him too. I look forward to
hearing from you with required informations on your reply.

Thanks and regards.


Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for your prompt response. I appreciate your dedication to your profession and the clarity with which you've explained your role.

I'm curious about the process that will be followed once I provide my current address. Could you please elaborate on this? Also, could you tell me more about the attorney who will be handling my case? 

As for providing banking details, I am a bit hesitant due to security reasons. Is there any other way we can proceed without sharing such sensitive information?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Dear Sir,

Don't worry yourself, your address is required for endorsement to relevant
documents that will be applied for in different ministries to get you
approval for the fund release. The attorney will explain better in
that regard to you.

If you don't want to release your account details for security reasons then
I assume you accept to your funds through security company diplomats.

The funds will be paid to their account and they will cash it out and
deliver to your home address or designated address. Are you fine with this?

I can't explain further on their behalf. I can say the brief
responsibilities of different sectors.
Regards,

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation. I appreciate your understanding regarding my concerns about sharing personal information.

The option of having the funds delivered to my home address or a designated address by security company diplomats sounds interesting. However, I would like to know more about this process. Could you please provide more details? For instance, how can I be sure that the delivery will be secure? Also, what kind of documentation will I need to provide or sign upon receipt of the funds?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Lois

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Dear Sir,

The Securities firm collects large amount of money on Cash from Customers
or their Bank, the money is either reinvested or kept for saved on Cash
until the customers comes to claim it.

The fund when deposited in Securities firm by the owner or representative
will be issued a certificate stating amount of money involved, reason for
depositing either for investment or consignment. Duration the owners want
it there.

When ever you come to claim your consignment they will demand for the
certificate of deposit. Secondly you will have to order them to hire their
delivery van with police men to escort the consignment straight to your
doorstep.they will charge you for their services.

For your information, you are required to register for the consignment
certification to prove is not for terrorism but for personal savings for
either a week, a month,a year or some years.

These are content they will demand from you for registration at the
securities companies. Your full name, address (either home, office, family,
relative or lodge),Date of Birth , Nationality (It could be where you live
as citizen or where you stay temporary) and your signature ( or
representative signature).


Their services are 100% secured. I can make arrangements for you to pickup
package in Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Saudi Arabia, UAE ,China,
South Africa, Turkey and Germany. You can pick up your funds and send it to
your bank account in any countries of your choice or invest on it. Please
be careful you must never disclose this to any body until you invest with
it or send it to any of your company account. Because I don't want mistakes
to come from your end.


Now you have known that the delivery are well secured and documents
required(Certificate of Ownership of Consignment). While here you need
three documents for claim of this funds including court order to withdraw
the fund on your behalf. Once this is done, I will contact any standard
securities companies to provide an account where I will deposit it to for
your own use.

Now select which country you would like to receive your funds for safe
keeping or investment purpose?
Regards,

Melanie Joly

subject: Re: Beneficiary payment for Lois
body:
Hello Melanie Joly,

Thank you for your detailed explanation about the process of depositing and claiming funds with a Securities firm. It's quite interesting to learn about the security measures in place, such as hiring a delivery van with police escorts. 

I'm curious, how does the registration process work to prove that the money is not for terrorism but for personal savings? Also, could you please elaborate more on the three documents required for claiming these funds?

As for your question, I think I would prefer to receive my funds in Canada. However, I'm still considering other options. Could you tell me more about how this process might differ depending on the country?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Lois
